list.name: Default
list.comment:
First draft of Planning Fixed a mistake in gigUI that resulted in Pages not being queried for popupItems. Corrected gigUI to hopefully ditch the cupertinoAdder when the page warrants. All that remains now is to import/export the Planning data
Forgot to redo LoggingPage's date range button handlers for a coherent state situation
reworking of iOS export
Reorganized Logging Page into separate file, gigUI() in main now asks the current page about add button and (in Android) the Popup Menu. Pages themselves answer for the faux iOS Toolbar with CupertinoTabBar
iOS fixes: -Logging page now same for both platforms -Attempt to cause getting of Stats when that page is active -Aim cupertinoAdder to call the current Page's fabClicked
Made toDollarString() return a string of the value actually rounded to the nearest penny, thus stopping a "fraction from hell" display
Need to handle "unknown category" with a SimpleDialog.

task.summary: Default task
Got the main logging and stats pages working-latter needs cosmetic work. Up next is the edit page, then bring in DB
Brought in Cupertino underpinnngs, and created a functional iOS version. Up next: -test this one out -unify Cupertino and Material(Android) variants
Fixed rounding issue in Logitem.toNumber(). Up next: -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway) -unify Cupertino and Material(Android) variants
Attempt at introducing forks for Cupertino and Material L&F. Said fork works on Android side. Now to test iOS side -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Made the category menu go platform-specific, and made rows out of the "What did I spend on" and "How much" blocks. -Need file export/import to make it REALLY useful on the "THIS is where my money goes" tip -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Got export working, but need to deal with "My Documents" vs "Documents" -Import needs to be able to figure out incoming columns and alert the user if fields are missing. -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Got export working, but need to deal with "My Documents" vs "Documents" Added Column headers on output, though -Import needs to be able to figure out incoming columns and alert the user if fields are missing. -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Put in the basics of "going native" on file selection...have some finishing to do there -Import needs to be able to figure out incoming columns and alert the user if fields are missing. -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Finished Android-native File "dialogs" -Import needs to be able to figure out incoming columns and alert the user if fields are missing. -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Import seems to be working right, but may need a setState() call. -Would like to believe that after that comes some decrufting and chroming -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

setState() call after import required the database inserts definitely finish first. Dealt with it by await modifiers. -Would like to believe that after that comes some decrufting and chroming -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

made the date import read mm/dd/yyyy format as well as ISO; removed one dead function. -Entry page suddenly looks haywire. --Need to show explanatory text when the category selection changes. --Huge space between datum titles and controls -Would like to believe that after that comes further decrufting and cosmetic stuff. -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Fixed errant use of CupertinoButton. Addressed too-wide gap between datum titles and controls. Made dropdown look consistent with other rows. -Need to show explanatory text when the category selection changes. -Would like to indicate multiple-line capability on ItemPage, probably should baseline-align "field hints" and fields. -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Explanatory text now shows on Android when the category selection changes. Aligned field titles with tops of fields -Would like to indicate multiple-line capability on ItemPage -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)

Simplified the valueChanged() for the amount field Indicated multiple-line capability on ItemPage with a gray background Added the mm/dd/yy format to import, and added proper handling of null Details field on export. Surely THIS has to be ready to go to market. -hoping for feedback from iOS users (may submit Android version anyway)
Added skeleton of PlanningPage, and may have found workaround for libc SEGV at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35250816/android-fatal-signal-11-sigsegv-code-1-fault-addr-0x0-in-tid-29092

(still struggling with apparent null pointer in debug library) The upper pane of PlanningPage now displays category data, and on an item click, runs a dialog to get the Amount. Remaining is to write the data to the Planitem table. --DBTransaction will check for preexistence on date and category (select id), and UPDATE or INSERT per the result of that. --I then need that isoOffsetDate(ddmonths,ddays,isoFrom), and the SimpleDialog

Random crash during debug seems to have been due to a glitch in the Dart version to which Flutter 0.11.0 was bound Planitem writes work now --next is the write to Logitem where the entryType is "planned"

Was unable to change dart-sdk, so adopted a "chatty release" strategy to find out what's going on . As such, spotted and fixed a bug in getPlannedTotals() that seemed to throw off saveCategoryPlan(). Up next: -Write to Logitem where the entryType is "planned"
Further down: -combine all DDL statements into InitDB() version 1

Changed Planning to do away with file-scope variable "canister", added the check for preexistence
Up next: -Write to Logitem where the entryType is "planned"
Further down: -combine all DDL statements into InitDB() version 1

Completed Planning page, but seem to have broken the Stats page Up next: -problem may be with state-setting.
Further down: -combine all DDL statements into InitDB() version 1
Fixed up Stats page, and made overall Dart code more to Dart/Flutter's liking. Up next MAY be to work the iOS version Further down: -combine all DDL statements into InitDB() version 1

Bug-hunting:unscrewed the File Save As part, save for a native-code Alert("The Money Logs cannot put files in this folder. Please choose another one), and where I forgot about that entryType field on import. Up next MAY be to work the iOS version Further down: -combine all DDL statements into InitDB() version 1

Fixed where date range got reset by change of page
Bug-hunting:unscrewed the File Save As part, save for a native-code Alert("The Money Logs cannot put files in this folder. Please choose another one), and where I forgot about that entryType field on import.
Up next MAY be to work the iOS version Further down: -combine all DDL statements into InitDB() version 1

fixed spacing and labeling
Bug-hunting:unscrewed the File Save As part, save for a native-code Alert("The Money Logs cannot put files in this folder. Please choose another one), and where I forgot about that entryType field on import.
Need to handle "unknown category" with a SimpleDialog.
Up next MAY be to work the iOS version. Odds are that file I/O per se goes native Further down: -combine all DDL statements into InitDB() version 1

Straightened up DDL, and feel confident enough to fool with iOS.Odds are that file I/O per se goes native
